final_answer:
The humor in this image arises from the contradiction and irony highlighted between the two parts of the image. On one side, there's an intricately designed, unused nail clipper, implying that it would be the logical choice for trimming nails. On the other side, the image shows someone biting their nails instead, which is an unexpected and less refined method.

The text "YES, BUT" sets up the expectation that the beautiful nail clippers should be used, yet the reality is humorously contrasted by the common habit of nail-biting. This juxtaposition is both unexpected and relatable, adding to the comedic effect.
